txt.en: Defeat attackers
You should <rgb=#FF0000>mourn</rgb> the refugees.
Agelwyn's speech did not go as well as she hoped, but several people are still willing to follow her
Speak with Agelwyn
You should speak with Agelwyn.
The first people you met in the Westfold have been murdered by the White Hand... innocent people.
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn lead her people to Helm's Deep.
Follow Agelwyn
Agelwyn needs your aid in escorting her people to Helm's Deep across the dangerous plains of the Westfold.
Speak with Agelwyn
'Everyone has gathered. I must address the people of Marton now....'
Defeat enemies in the way
Speak with Agelwyn
Speak with Agelwyn
Defeat enemies blocking the way ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Agelwyn is heartened by the good fortune encountered on the journey
Clear enemies from the path
Listen to Agelwyn
'You are very valiant, [placeholder]! I believe it is safe to continue on now.'
'Let us continue on, my friend. We are near! I can see Helm's Dike in the distance.'
Speak with Agelwyn
'This should prove to be an interesting journey. Shall we continue?'
<rgb=#FF0000>Mourn</rgb> the slaughtered innocents
It is safe to continue
Speak with Agelwyn
'Thank you, [placeholder]! We will continue now. Make haste, everyone!'
Agelwyn can be found further south along the river-banks.\n\nYou should speak with Agelwyn.
'Did you hear something, [placeholder]?'
Speak with Agelwyn
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn lead her people to Helm's Deep.
Keep the people of Marton safe
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn lead her people to Helm's Deep.
'That did not go well at all, but it is done. I will not look back now. Let us get this journey over with.\n\n'We ride at once!'
Follow Agelwyn
Enemies are closing in from all sides.\n\nYou should defeat the attackers.
Defeated an enemy ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Agelwyn stands near the river's shallows.\n\nYou should speak with Agelwyn.
Agelwyn believes that this cross-roads is not safe...
It is now safe to continue

'Did you know these poor people, [placeholder]? I am so sorry.

'...They were like us, were they not? Unarmed people, fleeing to the Hornburg for safety. If you had not been with us, this would have been us.

'Helm's Deep is so near! Let us continue, [placeholder].'
Agelwyn is on the river's edge.\n\nYou should speak with Agelwyn.
Agelwyn is near the northern river-bank in the upper Westfold.\n\nYou should speak with Agelwyn.
'We are almost there, and then we part ways. I cannot thank you enough for getting us through this.'
Agelwyn and her party are by the river-bank in the southern Westfold.\n\nYou should speak with Agelwyn.
Enemies can be found on the river-bank in the northern Westfold.\n\nYou should defeat the enemies upon the riverbank.
Agelwyn is undeterred by the rebellion of half of her followers
Agelwyn awaits you upon the river-bank in the Westfold.\n\nYou should speak with Agelwyn and tell her it is safe to continue.
'We have been blessed with a safe journey thus far! I hope it stays that way. Helm's Deep draws near.\n\n'Take heart, people of Marton! We are almost there.'
The river path is now safe
Agelwyn and her party are travelling along the river-bank towards Helm's Deep.\n\nYou should keep the people of Marton safe as they travel.
Agelwyn has died
Follow Agelwyn and keep her people safe.
Elstan has died

You recognize this person -- you saw these refugees on the road when you first entered the Westfold.\n\nThese poor folk never made it to Helm's Deep, for the plains were crawling with deadly servants of the enemy.
Instance: The Journey to Helm's Deep
Talk to Agelwyn
